greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k such that phi(n+k)=2*phi(n), where phi is Euler's totient function.
comment: Makowski shows that a k exists for each n. It appears that k<=2n. For prime n, it appears that n-1<=k<=2n.
reference: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, 3rd Ed., New York, Springer-Verlag, 2004, Section B36.
Andrzej Makowski, On the equation phi(n+k)=2*phi(n), Elem. Math., 29 (1974), 13.
link: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
xref: Cf. A050473 (least k such that phi(n+k)=2*phi(k)).
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Jul 15 2005
